intro: Marcellia mirabilis, commonly known as the miracle flower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or near water sources. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
